Review Text: The movie is extremely pedestrian.....it is well made.  The photography and all the elements for a great movie are there but the plot is without any real surprise and you can access the outcome way to early in the film.  Its too bad the scenery is great and the backdrop is really haunting.  The acting is fairly good.  The script should have been used as toliet paper....
Review Title: The photography and all the elements for a great movie are there but the plot is without any ...
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/02/21
Average Rating: 4.0
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Andrew Lau', 'Andrew Loo'], 'Producers': ['Allen Bain', 'Stuart Ford', 'Ara Katz', 'Andrew Lau', 'Jesse Scolaro', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Michael Bassick', 'Steven Chao', 'Claudie Chung', 'Corey Large', 'Deepak Nayar', 'Alan Pao', 'Art Spigel', 'Steven Squillante'], 'Starring': ['Justin Chon', 'Kevin Wu', 'Harry Shum Jr.'], 'Studio': ['A24 Distribution LLC']}
Review Text: The storyline is terrific.  Dialogue and acting is okay.  The direction is little shaky ....too much disoriented shots.......This could have been a great film but it needed a little more integration with the police angle......it seems ridiculous that suddenly the gang members want to help the police who have been essentially non-existent until the end of the film.  Either integrate the police into the story entirely or leave them out because its like an irritating cameo when Ray Liotta shows up with his Asian counterpart.....who you can't quite believe is really even up with what is going on in his own community.  The part about the book and the money is also stupid......a lot of extra scenes for nothing....should have written that in differently.  This film could have been so much better......I just felt it missed a great opportunity to be a great film and just fell short because it was not thought out better.
Review Title: Crouching tiger....meets Gritty Chinatown
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------

Jackson', 'Mary McCormack'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']}
Review Text: The movie started out JUST GREAT.....I was ready to get down when the main character checked into 1408...then the script and the main character's reactions got ridiculous.......they took a great idea......an okay script and then F'd it up......It seems the script must have ended up in ROOM 1408....because it seems it suffered the same naufrage or shipwreck that the main character did.......the best scene was his chase in the vents.....everything else was ....disappointingly mundane.....a stoic writer suddenly starts reacting like a scared schoolgirl ...just plain dumb.
Review Title: Script must have ended up in Room 1408....
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/02/21
Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Martin Scorsese'], 'Producers': ['Mike Medavoy', 'Arnold Messer', 'Brad Fischer', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Starring': ['Leonardo DiCaprio', 'Mark Ruffalo', 'Ben Kingsley']}
Review Text: This was a great movie......I was going all the way. The end on the other hand had to long of a antithesis......I would have liked a faster resolution .....to cinematically wordy is the best way I can describe it.  Love the shots that pan all the way out and in  on the island and the scenes.......very artsty......and THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU Mr. Scorcese for NOT SHAKING YOUR CAMERAS around during scenes......I can't understand how so many films are produced with this STUPID IRRITATING CAMERA WORK and you want the public to accept this as a professionals work.  A couple of panning mistakes , I counted two.  but other than that ....spot on.  DiCaprio pulled off the Boston persona without it being overdone.....and the local and scenes were believable while still holding to the story.......This film should have gotten more critical acclaim.
Review Title: Terrific Entertaiment ....TOP NOTCH
Rating: 5.0

Review Text: This was a very good film. I enjoyed everything about it.  Keaton; character is clearly well developed.  The camera work is GREAT considering all the running back and forth....none of that camera shaking that is so DAMN IRRITATING that I would like to scream.  The movement from character to character gives a wonderful narrative of each of the main characters. Worth that watch.

Average Rating: 4.6
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Fincher'], 'Producers': ['Cean Chaffin', 'Joshua Donen', 'Arnon Milchan', 'Reese Witherspoon', 'Leslie Dixon', 'Bruna Papandrea'], 'Starring': ['Ben Affleck', 'Rosamund Pike', 'Neil Patrick Harris']}
Review Text: I was okay with the film until the end .....it was believable and twisted just like its characters but it got a little messy and too unbelievable at the end ....Amazing Amy was just a bit too OVERACTING in the Hospital ward and that was not due to the actress but the director and the plot.....her character was subtle and laid back even when she was being a manipulative psycho...suddenly she was disorganized and it seemed her manipulation was overplayed......this was a flaw in the script and needed to be worked on.  Other than that it was worth the time.
Review Title: A twisted tale of love.....

Review Text: I have never seen such a waste of film and resources as in this piece of pantywaste.  The entire film consists of 35 minutes of storyline and then the rest is running through the old, building with a flashlight.....the most entertaining part of the entire film is when the last female character is running through the building and the ghost throws the radiator as she is going for the 20 yard line.....seriously this a bad film...I have seen worse but that is no excuse.

Review Text: A very gritty movie....not for teens or children.  I like the main character (but the director has her smoking too much its distracting....she could bite her lip or something similar to show her nervousness as well).  The entire cast is really good and has a lot of depth in their characters.  The story line is well thought out and intricate as well.....keeps your interest until the very end.  I thought it was over after the basement scene and then BOOM there is more......can't wait to see the other two in the series.....but I have to wait until I HAVE AN ENTIRE EVENING to read the subtitles.....
Review Title: Excellent gritty mystery thriller.....

Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ron Howard'], 'Producers': ['Ron Howard'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hanks', 'Ewan McGregor', 'Ayelet Zurer']}
Review Text: I saw this movie when it first came it.....liked it then and it was great the second time around as well.  Ron Howard must have had a hell of a budget and lots of writers because the story ties together with a sorts of historical points and sites.....I can't imagine what it cost to shoot this puppy.  The acting is pretty damn good as well.  The only thing I DO NOT LIKE is the fact the "God Particular" issue is not questioned more.....it would have been nice to say.....CREATING LIFE is not CREATING A SOUL and MIND but I guess the writers in Hollywhack are not that good all the time....what can I say......
Review Title: I liked this SO MUCH the first time it was released I WATCHED again....

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Cymbeline
Review Date: 2015/06/08
Categories: Suspense, Drama, Gritty, Intense
Product Description: ['HD. The ruthless leader of a motorcycle gang fights to secure his family’s legacy in this gritty, modern-day Shakespeare adaptation.']
Average Rating: 3.3
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Almereyda'], 'Producers': ['Michael Benaroya', 'Anthony Katagas', 'Michael Almereyda'], 'Starring': ['Ethan Hawke', 'Ed Harris', 'Milla Jovovich']}
Review Text: I have seen a lot of versions of Shakespeare plays but this is the WORST!,,,,It is bad enough that the wonderful dialogue has been reduced to some sort of modern delivery of the bards words and timing  but the RIDICULOUSNESS of the scenes was just the limit......when the King and queen are bringing tribute in the form of hershey's kisses that is where I draw the line.....WHAT KIND OF MOCKERY are you making of wonderful SHAKESPEARE....the director, screenwriters and EVEN ACTORS should be told what an INSULT they have delivered to the bard.  DID YOU DELIBERATELY go out of your way to do this?  Its sacrilege.  I am sorry that I rented it TWICE since I missed the first time....I was all excited to really see it........BIG MISTAKE! SUCK SUCK SUCK.....don't ever undertake Shakespeare again....YOU ARE RIDICULOUS....learning lines is NOT ENOUGH...adaptations are NOT ENOUGH.....there has to be REAL SUBSTANCE......Shakespeare wrote REAL PLAYS about human emotions and insights....this was nothing but using his play and words to try to make GARBAGE work.....
Review Title: DO NOT RENT THIS MOVIE ....IT IS a RIDICULOUS version of SHAKESPEARE
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2015/07/23
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Lou Adler'], 'Producers': ['Lou Adler', 'Lou Lombardo'], 'Starring': ['Cheech Marin', 'Thomas', 'Edie Adams'], 'Studio': ['PARAMOUNT PICTURES']}
Review Text: I know this was their first movie but its not a 'classic' by any shot of the imagination only mediocre at best.  The dope jokes get old after a while and the sex jokes are very basic......their later work is better by far.  Its a start for them as comedians...but it tortures the viewer a bit in places....
Review Title: Unfortunately this movie like the state of California is exactly like the title says......"Up in Smoke"
Rating: 1.0

Review Text: A very gritty movie....not for teens or children.  I like the main character (but the director has her smoking too much its distracting....she could bite her lip or something similar to show her nervousness as well).  The entire cast is really good and has a lot of depth in their characters.  The story line is well thought out and intricate as well.....keeps your interest until the very end.  I thought it was over after the basement scene and then BOOM there is more......can't wait to see the other two in the series.....but I have to wait until I HAVE AN ENTIRE EVENING to read the subtitles.....
Review Title: Excellent gritty mystery thriller.....

Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'smoking', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ron Howard'], 'Producers': ['Ron Howard'], 'Starring': ['Tom Hanks', 'Ewan McGregor', 'Ayelet Zurer']}
Review Text: I saw this movie when it first came it.....liked it then and it was great the second time around as well.  Ron Howard must have had a hell of a budget and lots of writers because the story ties together with a sorts of historical points and sites.....I can't imagine what it cost to shoot this puppy.  The acting is pretty damn good as well.  The only thing I DO NOT LIKE is the fact the "God Particular" issue is not questioned more.....it would have been nice to say.....CREATING LIFE is not CREATING A SOUL and MIND but I guess the writers in Hollywhack are not that good all the time....what can I say......

Categories: Suspense, Drama, Gritty, Intense
Product Description: ['HD. The ruthless leader of a motorcycle gang fights to secure his family’s legacy in this gritty, modern-day Shakespeare adaptation.']
Average Rating: 3.3
Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Almereyda'], 'Producers': ['Michael Benaroya', 'Anthony Katagas', 'Michael Almereyda'], 'Starring': ['Ethan Hawke', 'Ed Harris', 'Milla Jovovich']}
Review Text: I have seen a lot of versions of Shakespeare plays but this is the WORST!,,,,It is bad enough that the wonderful dialogue has been reduced to some sort of modern delivery of the bards words and timing  but the RIDICULOUSNESS of the scenes was just the limit......when the King and queen are bringing tribute in the form of hershey's kisses that is where I draw the line.....WHAT KIND OF MOCKERY are you making of wonderful SHAKESPEARE....the director, screenwriters and EVEN ACTORS should be told what an INSULT they have delivered to the bard.  DID YOU DELIBERATELY go out of your way to do this?  Its sacrilege.  I am sorry that I rented it TWICE since I missed the first time....I was all excited to really see it........BIG MISTAKE! SUCK SUCK SUCK.....don't ever undertake Shakespeare again....YOU ARE RIDICULOUS....learning lines is NOT ENOUGH...adaptations are NOT ENOUGH.....there has to be REAL SUBSTANCE......Shakespeare wrote REAL PLAYS about human emotions and insights....this was nothing but using his play and words to try to make GARBAGE work.....
Review Title: DO NOT RENT THIS MOVIE ....IT IS a RIDICULOUS version of SHAKESPEARE
Rating: 2.0
--------------------------------------------------

Review Text: I know this was their first movie but its not a 'classic' by any shot of the imagination only mediocre at best.  The dope jokes get old after a while and the sex jokes are very basic......their later work is better by far.  Its a start for them as comedians...but it tortures the viewer a bit in places....

raw_response:
**Key Preferences and Trends:**

- **Genres:** Predominantly enjoys gritty, suspenseful movies, with a strong preference for gangster films and suspenseful dramas.
- **Ratings:** Frequently rates films highly, typically achieving scores above 4.0, indicating a tendency to appreciate quality storytelling and production.
- **Critique Style:** Analytical and articulate reviews highlight strong preferences for narrative coherence, character development, and cinematography, particularly disapproving of poor script quality and overdone camera work.
- **Highlights of Appreciation:** Enjoys strong direction and well-rounded characters; often praises films that are well-shot and engaging.
- **Disappointments:** Shows a marked aversion to poorly executed adaptations and films lacking substantial plots or depth, particularly in horror and adaptations of classic literature.
- **Television Affection:** Expresses deep appreciation for specific series with a strong emotional connection, citing viewership dedication.
- **Content Themes:** Engaged by complex character arcs, enjoyable dialogue, and impactful themes, with a notable dislike for clichés and predictable outcomes.
- **Humor:** Responds positively to comedic elements when done effectively, but critiques shallow humor in films aimed purely at broad comedic appeal. 

Overall, this individual displays a keen and discerning eye for film quality, gravitating towards complex narratives and emotional depth across genres.

target_interaction.title: Superb mystery for mature minds.....
target_interaction.text: I really liked this film....the story is filled with wonderful characterizations which the actors and actresses project wonderfully.  I was extremely impressed with the entire cast the younger players that portray the Day family are extremely good.  This deconstructs the original "event" from many viewpoints......it allows the narrative to be centered on each character as the storyline progresses.......really good work from the author and writer of the screenplay.....kudos for the entire cast and those behind tell scenes......sometimes mysteries can be deep.....and this is one for top o the list.
